name: Monument to Francesc Soler i Rovirosa

reviews.text:
This monument stands in tribute to Francesc Soler i Rovirosa, a 19th century Spanish painter and theatre stage designer. In Spain, he is widely credited with playing an important role in the rebirth of Spanish scenic design. His works continue to be exhibited in Spain the Institut del Teatre and the Gran Teatre del Liceu, both in Barcelona, and the Museum of Art in Sabadell, just to name three.

The sculpture is located just in front of Prats Joiers on the Gran Via de les Corts Catalanas, at the boundary of Jardins de la Reina Victoria. The work is a sculpture atop a pedestal. While the pedestal is a simple rectangular block about two metres high with a medallion embedded and featuring a likeness of Soler i Rovirosa. Atop the pedestal is a figure of a woman holding a rose. She seems to be in the moment of offering the flower to the artist. The figure is naked except for a cloth draped loosely over her hips and she wears an expression of calm in almost as if the artist was aping classical sculptures.

The monument is wroth a look if in the Placa de Catalunya area and if time allows.

Free.
Visit Duration: 5 minutes.

Monument dedicated to Francesc Soler i Rovirosa, a Catalan set designer who played an important role in the rebirth of Spanish scenic design.
